main event: A bright object was observed flying over Ludington, Michigan on July 11, 1963.
interesting points: The object looked as bright as a bright star and was observed to fly out of sight in 2 minutes.
The flight path of the object could not be seen, but it was informed that the object increased in speed.
The witness, T. Hunckle, is a plant chemist at Dow Chemical Co. in Midland, Michigan and has seen similar objects before.
The U.S. Coast Guard station in Ludington told the witness they did not know what the object was, as it was of massive size.
The Federal Communications Commission forwarded the report to the National Aeronautics & Space Administration for further investigation.
